## Single trait distribution

What is the lowest and highest bill lengths do penguins in this dataset have? Do different species have different bill lengths? How much do they overlap?

```{r}
ggplot(data = penguins) + 
  geom_boxplot(mapping = aes (x = species, y = bill_length_mm)) +
  geom_jitter(aes(x = species, y = bill_length_mm), alpha = 0.25, color = "purple")

# It seems that, on average, Chinstrap has higher bill lengths at 49 mm. However, Gentoo had the biggest outlier at 59 mm. Adelie is shortest â€” the average is 38 mm with an outlier of 32 mm. 

# Different species have different lengths. 

# Chinstrap and Gentoo overlap the most with each other. 

# density plot for overlap 
# scatter plot 

## cow plot package pastes together two different grids
```   

```{r}
ggplot(data = penguins) + 
  geom_density(mapping = aes(x = bill_length_mm, fill = species), alpha = 0.5)

# I didn't know density plots existed! This is so cool. 
# I can use density to plot overlap in different values for the same variable. 
```

```{r}
 ggplot(data = penguins) +
  geom_histogram(mapping = aes(x = bill_length_mm, fill=species)) +
  facet_wrap(~species, nrow=3)

# Use facet_wrap so you can divide up your histogram so it's split up and not overlapping. 
```
